problem_text:
21.98. Let w be a multilinear commutator word, and assume that G is a group where the set of w-values is covered by finitely many cyclic subgroups. Is it true that the verbal subgroup w(G) is finite-by-cyclic?
This is true for lower central words (G. Cutolo, C. Nicotera, J. Algebra, 324, no. 7 (2010), 1616–1624).
M. Morigi
